channel.title: Hosting problem
channel.description:
Alright, I bought an windows VPS at VPSland.com , I uploaded the server files, installed JDK, set paths etc. But the problem is, It won't connect. Now I've seen a post that they blocked port 43594, How can I change the port of my RSPS? I'm using a delta base. And should it be changed to 5555 or 43595?
Regards

item.title: Hosting problem
item.dc:creator: @_SITTION |SITTION|
item.description:
@_SITTION wrote:

Your Master:

We do not help with VPS issues here, there is tutorials for this.

Read full topic

item.title: Hosting problem
item.dc:creator: @1v2l3a4m5e6n 1v2l3a4m5e6n
item.description:
@1v2l3a4m5e6n wrote:

Wintercanon:

You shouldn’t need to install JDK on your VPS that is just wasting space. Do a simple JRE install. Make sure the server is binding to VPS’s IP and not localhost. I doubt they blocked the port.

Okay, but everything is set on the IP of the VPS, still aint working

Read full topic

item.title: Hosting problem
item.dc:creator: @Wintercanon Wintercanon
item.description:
@Wintercanon wrote:

You shouldn’t need to install JDK on your VPS that is just wasting space. Do a simple JRE install. Make sure the server is binding to VPS’s IP and not localhost. I doubt they blocked the port.

Read full topic
